Title: Recruiting Coordinator (Contract)
RoleDescription:
At Riot, our Recruiting team plays a critical role in attracting and engaging top talent to help us build the future of our games and experiences. We are passionate about delivering a seamless and thoughtful hiring process while ensuring an excellent candidate experience. As part of this team, you will collaborate with recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates to support the end-to-end recruitment process, drive operational excellence, and contribute to projects that enhance our recruiting efforts.
The Recruiting Coordinators primary goal is to help guide candidates through the pipeline efficiently, with candidate experience at the heart of their mission. They are an essential part of the recruitment process, from scheduling phone screens/onsite/meet & greets to hosting on-campus candidates, giving tours, and facilitating candidate expenses. 
As a Recruiting Coordinator in the APAC Recruiting Team, you are responsible for directly influencing the logistics and coordination of candidate interviewing scenarios. You often use your discretion to determine interview dates, hotel and airline booking options, and any related logistical outcome. You are also expected to influence the usage of best practices, tools, and processes related to their work.

Work closely with recruiters, hiring managers, and HRBPs to schedule interviews and meetings in an efficient and timely manner
Handle candidate travel arrangements if needed
Maintain recruiting system data integrity (open roles, update candidate information/ communication)
Conduct teams hiring efficiency analysis and provide insights
Handles and prioritizes multiple ranges of advanced administrative duties with wide latitude for independent judgment and initiative.

Required Qualifications

1-6 years of experience in Recruiting or HR craft in an admin or coordination capacity
Strong written and verbal English and Mandarin 
Excellent interpersonal skills
Prior knowledge of HR resources and tools

Desired Qualifications

Experience with ATS/CRM tools
Good at data analysis
Passion for the gaming industry

 
Employment Type: employment contract with FESCO Adecco, a professional personnel company in China.

RoleDescription:
Riots Technical Artists focus on supporting artists with industry-leading tools, systems, and techniques to enable them to realize their work in-game. You will work with artists across all departments from modeling to lighting to ensure all assets work within the scope of the technical pipeline requirements. The Senior Rendering Technical Artist on League of Legends is a subject matter expert that is accountable for driving progress in regards to lighting, shading, and materials used by the League Engine, in both the in-game and around-game space. You will collaborate with the rendering vision holder and art teams to set targets for this progress. You will be authoring shaders that push the boundaries of look development within League, and advocate for new rendering features on behalf of your team that would benefit from them. You will also be hands-on and directly support content and tools teams as a Shader expert.

Author industry-defining lighting, shaders, and materials to push the quality of Leagues broad catalogue of characters, VFX, and other artistic crafts
Co-opt a future-facing plan for material and shader workflows, tools, and engine improvements to support creative goals from the Art and Product teams
Work with art teams to evaluate current rendering technology and craft a plan to evolve existing systems
Collaborate with tools and rendering teams on enhancements to our materials, shaders tools, and rendering workflows
Be a bridge between Art and Engineering in the realm of materials and shaders to help both disciplines communicate effectively
Create and consolidate documentation for using our materials and shader systems, and build discipline-wide habits to keep them up to date
Promote performance optimization for art assets by creating clear standards and building a maintainable process for reviewing and optimizing game assets

Required Qualifications: 

8+ years of professional experience as a graphics or rendering technical artist in games or related industries
Extensive experience in material development and shader writing using HLSL, CG, or other real-time shading languages
A collaborative attitude towards bridging the gap between artistic goals and technical considerations with Art and Engineering
A comprehensive understanding of modern lighting theory, including physically based rendering and other associated technologies and techniques used in modern consumer-grade game engines such as Unreal or Unity
An ability to translate artistic requirements into functional and performant Materials and Shaders to be used at runtime
Demonstrable experience authoring shaders and materials for 2D surfaces such as UI panels and motion graphics
Experience profiling and optimizing performance of Shaders with tools such as RenderDoc or other industry standard systems

A thorough understanding of 3D math used in real-time rendering
Experience with look dev, color theory, camera lenses, and lighting direction
Expertise in content creation and tool development in DCC tools, especially Maya, Photoshop, 3DCoat, Marmoset, Substance Designer and Painter

Title: Senior Narrative Editor
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. That's where you come in.

You will also work closely with the team to strengthen our workflow, preventing opportunities for errors and mistakes.

To reinforce Riots collaborative culture in our China offices, weve decided to do away with the constraints of traditional hierarchical title structures that are more common in the region. Titles dont really matter at any of Riots offices, but we chose to take this extra step in our China offices to foster a space where teamwork thrives. Understand the relevant audiences for the game, and from this, calibrate your design expertise to reflect appropriate taste for these audiences
Implement card content and rules from source language (English), and build robust localization methodology for long-term content update
Design onboarding experience for new TCG players that provide intuitive learning and keep integrity to the core game rules
Take ultimate responsibility for the handoff of error-free card text and rule materials
Maintain good working relationships with product teams, stakeholders, and Localization partners, and actively drive improvements to Riot Games multi-language publishing processes
Assist in the ongoing development of process documentation, rules documents, templating standards, and style guides

Required Qualifications:

5+ years of professional editing experience, including experience working on games, or equivalent advanced degree with strong practical experience
At least 3 years of experience in game content design or editing within a game development team, preferably on live or competitive game products
Proven ability to own systems or content pipelines independently from concept to delivery
Bilingual communication skills (English and Chinese), with demonstrated experience in writing or editing game-facing materials
Deep understanding and familiarity with Trading Card Games (TCGs)
Proven ability to deliver high-quality work through cross-disciplinary collaboration, including resolving creative misalignments and driving consensus across narrative, design, and product teams
Experience managing or contributing to multi-language content workflows, including shaping localization standards, terminology consistency, and long-term content scalability
Demonstrated ability to maintain and evolve living documentation, including style guides, rule templates, and workflow standards that support team-wide consistency and scalability.

Demonstrated contribution to the creation or evolution of editorial standards, content pipelines, or localization strategies
Familiarity with the League of Legends IP and its narrative/world systems

Experience building onboarding experiences for new players or writing game documentation at a system level
